subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etym}}
{{liushu|p}} (''{{w|Shuowen}}''), indicating a ladle-shaped ''dou'' (see below) held by hand.

subSections.title: Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{zh-forms|alt=𤣫,𠦁,𣁬}}
Pronunciations 1 (“dipper, ladle”) and 2 (“water ladle”) are cognate. Variant character: {{zh-l|枓|ladle}}. They probably belong to the same word family as {{och-l|注|to pour}}, as a derived noun. Within Sino-Tibetan, compare {{cog|bo|ཆུ||water}}, {{m|bo|འཆུ||to scoop up, to ladle water}}.

subSections.title: Definitions
Readings
Compounds
Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|と}}

# an obsolete unit of liquid measure equal to 18 liters or 18000 cc.

subSections.title: Hanja
subSections.text:
{{ko-hanja|hangeul=두|eumhun=}}

# ([[말]] 두): [[measure]] of about 18 [[liter]]s; such measuring vessel
# ([[조두]] 두): [[cauldron]]; [[cymbal]]
# ([[구기]] 두): [[dipper]], [[ladle]]
# ([[별]][[이름]] 두): [[asterism]] around [[Polaris]] such as [[Big Dipper]] and [[Little Dipper]]
